Quote.Speaker: Rolando
Quote.Text: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Rolando. Oh yes, she's been expecting your call. [knocks on door]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Rolando
Quote.Text: Karen? He's on line one.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thanks Ro. Hey, we finally connected. How's Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin Utica branch. Turns out it's a pretty easy gig when your boss isn't an idiot and your boyfriend's not in love with somebody else.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Look, All I'm saying is it would be a great opportunity, and we'd love to have you come aboard. So think about it, okay? Okay, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Look, for the record, a certain Scranton salesman approached me, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He looks like your twin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a dummy, a la Ferris Bueller's Day Off. We have tied a string to the wrist, which goes to the door. When somebody opens the door, the hand goes down, hits the remote, turns on the tape recorder, which is me snoring. Now nobody knows whether I am here, or whether I am gone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But, you will not tell anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I won't need to because we'll be together playing hooky. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, sometimes. Most of the time I will be with Ryan, or Darryl. [knock on the door] Yes? Oh good, good Stanley! First victim, this is what I want you to do. Go out, come back in. We're going to hide. I want you to tell me if this looks like me, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't understand why sleeping at your desk is better than you not being here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just go out, and come back in.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I got an offer from Utica for more money, and I'm going to take it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey everyone, can I have your attention please? I just thought you all should know that Stanley Hudson is planning on leaving us, because our old friend Karen from Utica is going to give him more money to work there.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no-no, no no. You completely misinterpreted my tone, this is a horrible thing. Clearly, Karen is trying to get back at us because Jim dumped her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't think that is what's happening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, smarty pants, then why? Why is she trying to take Stanley from us?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I think it's because of my sales record.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That could not possibly be it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You cannot take the hilarious black guy from the office. Stanley is part of what makes this branch so extraordinary. The bluesy wisdom, the sassy remarks, the crossword puzzles, the smile, those big watery red eyes. I don't know how George Bush did it when Colin Powell left, and if Utica thinks that they are going to poach Stanley, they have another thing coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How can I get you to stay?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah we all want money. But there is none in the budget, so... Tell me why you're really leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mo money mo problems, Stanley. You of all people should know that. Let me ask you this, if I were-

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pssh, kay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, did you bring it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: To be Edwardian. His best work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well I have the tablecloth, don't forget the flatware.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sure thing Pam, can't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, Toby, and I are founding members of the Finer Things Club. We meet once a month to discuss books and art, celebrate culture in a very civilized way. Sometimes the debate can get heated, but we're always respectful. There is no paper, no plastic, and no work talk allowed. It's very exclusive.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Besides having sex with men, I would say that the Finer Things Club is the gayest thing about me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So tell me again why I can't be part of your club?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because some people think you monopolize the conversation by trying to be funny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Some people.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fillipellers, how's it hanging?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To the left?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Listen, I-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To the right?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, enough small talk, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You called me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, listen, um... You cannot tear Stanley from his family like this.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm pretty sure his family's coming with him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, his work family. Look, this is very hard for me, but I'm going to give you my best man. You may have Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Toby's not a salesperson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can train him. He's very very smart, and funny, and charming... You know, I can't do it, Toby is the worst. That- that was a bluff, um... Listen, if you are going to poach one of my guys, I'm going to poach one of yours.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oooh. Good-bye Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, good-bye. Wait! Wait! Karen, could you transfer me to one of your salespeople please? Your best one? [Karen hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have Ben Nugent on the line, he is the top salesman in Utica.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi Ben, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Ben
Quote.Text: Hi Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to cut right to the chase here. Do you like magic? Because I'm a genie in a bottle, and I'm going to grant you three wishes. To move to Scranton, to have a great job, and to be my best friend.

Quote.Speaker: Ben
Quote.Text: Aren't you the guy that hit the woman with your car?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Get out. [to Ben] Uh, yeah. I also saved her life, but I guess that's not as grabby.

Quote.Speaker: Ben
Quote.Text: Everyone says Scranton branch is worse than Camden. Didn't everyone from Stanford quit, like immediately?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I fired them, and your next. ... So what do you say?

Quote.Speaker: Ben
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that guy talking about? Scranton is not lame. Scranton is the cool, fun branch. We're like Animal House.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Found him!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, we're getting crapped on. Word is that our branch sucks, and we have to do something about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So what are you going to do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are we going to do? We are going to make a monster sale, that's what we're going to do. Corcroan dropped Staples.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did they?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes they did, oh yes they did, and we are going to murder it. You, me, Dwight are going to jump into my PT Cruiser, and we're going to crush this sale. We're going to prove, what the hell is that music?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's Vivaldi, for Finer Things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's the problem, that's the problem. We need rock n' roll Pam, rock n' roll. Alright? [sees Toby in a bow-tie holding a plate full of tea cups] Oh... My... God, that's why people are leaving. I- I have no words.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We just passed the exit for Corcroan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? What? We did?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Michael
Quote.Text: Surprise! Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at his face! Look at his face!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are we doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Egg dripping, blah, blah, blah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are we doing, Dwight, what we are doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, gee, Jim, I don't know, I guess there's no sales call today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are going on a panty raid to Utica, is what we're doing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We're going to Utica?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not going to Utica right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you are. Oh, buckle up Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are going to make Karen wish that she had never been dumped by you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: [chanting] Utica! Utica! Utica!

Quote.Speaker: Michael and Dwight
Quote.Text: [chanting] Utica! Utica!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In your face

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yow!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe you guys. I'm not going to go further piss off my ex-girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you calling Karen?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not calling Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's lying.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing? Stop it, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throws Jim's cell phone out of the window] Gah-ah-hah-ha!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No communication with the outside world Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It had to be done, it had to be done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that kind of sucks, because it had all the photos of my brother's new baby on it, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh no, that is too bad. Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight, he found it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? I'm just going to call a cab from here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, you're going to miss the best prank ever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Wait, what are you planning on doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you really wanna know?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, God. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Follow me, come here. Here's what we brought, we brought uniforms from the warehouse. I brought silly string, Dwight brought gasoline and chunks of rubber to make stink bombs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or real bombs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, not real bombs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, come on, it will be so badass.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, maybe, maybe, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It could be badass. Yeah, it will.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no absolutely we are not doing this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, I already filled the bottles with the gas, it's going to be so badass.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? We've been driving around with this stuff in the trunk the whole time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Teach her to offer Stanley more money.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So the deal was, Dwight doesn't blow anything up, and I wear a costume. And a moustache.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, why did you and Karen break up? Was it the sex?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't imagine the sex being bad, I mean her body is...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't we play that alphabet game that you were talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I will start. Um, "A." [singing] "A" my name is Alan, and my wife's name is Alice, we live in Alaska, and we sell... Damn it! What do we sell? Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm trying to think of what we could sell.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, la, la, la. What is that? That sound... The air-conditioning leaking or something?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That doesn't make sense, couldn't be.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that? Dwight, are you peeing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm peeing in this empty can.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on man, that is disgusting Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well you said that we couldn't make anymore stops, and I really had to go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, watch the road!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you're making me spray!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll kill you man!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael! Michael, pull over!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is just so disgusting!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pull over, pull over!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think I cut my penis on the lid!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can you imagine a life where all you have to do is summer in the Italian countryside?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I know right? I just want to go, and look at art, and swim in the Adriatic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And spend time with George Emerson. That's what I would do. I mean it's the best male protagonist we've read, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [joins them at the table] Totally, I mean, come on, such a free spirit.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just came to discuss my favorite E.M. Forester novel. Pam, these finger sandwiches look finger-lickin' delicious Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, I'm sorry Andy, but this is a closed club.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The Finer Things Club is the most exclusive club in this office. Naturally, it's where I need to be. The party planning committee is my back up, and Kevin's band is my safety.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine. I'll just sit here, in the common area, and read my book. Which just happens to be the very same book you're reading.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright, just know that you're not in the Finer Things Club.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why can't I be in the club?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe we're here, I can't believe this is happening.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Believe it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Afro wig, do you want the afro wig?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Michael. I'm not leaving the car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Dwight, here's how it's going to go down. You and I-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Guy's going by. Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and I are going to sneak inside and pretend that we are warehouse workers. And then we will silly string the beejeezus out of the place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And if we have to defend ourselves, I will stab the security guy in the eye with the jumbo chalk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, you won't do that. Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then I'll grind up the jumbo chalk and blow it in his eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, nothing with the eyes, please?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, that's her! That's her, go, go, go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's move! Move, move, move, move!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shut up, you, shut up! This is the dumbest thing we've ever done.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think it's interesting how Forster uses Italy to represent sexuality and passion. [Kevin dumping change in the snack machine] And that also brought up themes of, uh, you know, fate and coincidence. And Lucy's torn between these two things. She's torn between passion and convention.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It just- [Kevin banging and shaking the snack machine] To be making a case for passion in Edwardian times, I thought was, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Damn it! [banging machine]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe sort of ahead of his time as a writer.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Very brave. [Phyllis beeping microwave in the background]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Very brave choice also, I thought.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And George, his- his youthfulness. His, um, freedom. [Phyllis still beeping the microwave] Evokes, um, um, feeling, um, to the, um... What are you microwaving!?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Popcorn.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why don't you use the microwave in the kitchen, Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Someone needs to clean it. It smells like popcorn.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, Stanley, are you really outta here?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yep, looks that way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna miss you man, you've been like an uncle to me. Like a kind old uncle Remus. I wanna stay in touch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [from the walkie-talkie] We are in a stairwell.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [from the walkie-talkie] We are climbing some stairs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm breathing heavily.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? You don't need to be updating me as much as you're updating me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's a guy, there's a guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's a security guard coming by. Hello, we're warehouse workers. Would you like more proof?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God, oh my God, that was very close.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can see the security guard's eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, don't do anything to them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have to do something to his eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The eyes are the groin of the head.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, Great Scott, if you found that choking hazard poster, just head on home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We found something far better, their crown jewel. Their industrial copier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Isn't that thing huge?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's enormous, but it's got wheels. We're wheeling it down the hall, into the stairwell. Get the car ready, keep the engine running.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that is a terrible idea, don't do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aha! [crashing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My hip bone!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're wedged between the copier and the railing. Ah! Ow! Ow, my leg! Jim leave us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't leave us!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Save yourself!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't leave us, help us, we need help Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay! First of all, stop using my name. And second of all-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you gotta move!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Damn it guys!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, could you move over a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm losing control of my bladder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, oh my God, Karen is back!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you say Karen?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take her to a motel, make love to her Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just say you wanna get back together.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not doing that!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It doesn't have to mean anything. Just, do it for Stanley. Come on Jim, just climb on top of her and think about Stanley. Ah, Jim, if this is it for me, promise me something, host the Dundies.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Uh, what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: First of all, hi.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You good? I'm just checking on the other branches. Michael wants me to do that from time to time, so...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do not tell Karen about the industrial copier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Copy that.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I cried for weeks over that guy, so yeah, seeing him climb out of a PT Cruiser in a ladies warehouse uniform, felt pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Let me ask you, did you accomplish what you wanted?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen lady, you can expect these kind of repercussions as long as you keep trying to poach our people.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm taking Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then we will burn Utica to the ground.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispers] Dwight. Granted, maybe this was not the best idea, but at least we care enough about our employees that we are willing to fight for them. And if you so much as harm a hair on Stanley's head, we will burn Utica to the ground. [they get up to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Jim, hang on a second?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: So you're still doing this kind of stuff, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, trying to quit though.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: If you wanted to see me, you could have just called me like an adult.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, I didn't want to see you. Not that I'm not happy seeing you, right now, I'm just saying ultimately I was here for the copier. Equal, I'd say it was equal. So, good to see you...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [huffs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, it's just that- [clears throat] You know, Pam and I are still dating, so, and, I just mean that things are going really well, so I didn't want to see... you...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, things are going really well? Are they? They are? That's great, that's so great. I wanna hear more about how happy you are with Pam. Can you tell me more about that? Thank you so much for coming to Utica, and breaking my copier, and telling me how well things are going in your relationship, really, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [slinking out of the room] Alright, you are welcome. I'm going to go because of, um, traffic.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Traffic, yeah. Oh, def- go, go because of traffic, definitely, beat-beat the traffic, mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I... will... [gives up and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We tried and we failed. Stanley, you may go. Here is a box, for your things, but I doubt that that box will be able to contain all the memories that you have of this place. Fly away sweet little bird, fly away and be free. Pam, I'm gonna need some help writing a want ad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, wanted:

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I wasn't really planning on leaving, all I wanted was a raise. How on Earth did Michael call my bluff? Is he some sort of secret genius? [laughs] Sometimes I say crazy things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, Rolando told me everything. How humiliating. Would it help you to return to another age? A time of refinement, and civility.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you inviting me to the Finer Things Club?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [nods head yes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh-oh, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Irish accent] Angela's Ashes, top o' the morning to us. Frankie's prose is funnier than a pot of gold, say I.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, did you get it out of your system.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. No, I mean I really liked it. I thought was uh, a fun read.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Fun?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What was fun about it for you? Was it the death of the twins?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that wasn't fun.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Did you even read it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Of course I read it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How does it end?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Who was the main character?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Angela. Nope. The ashes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [mouths "I'm sorry" to Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And let me just add, that as a member of The Finer Things Club, I would bring a strong financial contribution to any discretionary funds that we may have. Finally, here is a recommendation from former U.S. Senator Rick Santorum.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, that's enough, uh. Thanks, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmmhmm. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He's gonna ruin everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. His letter of recommendation from Rick Santorum is three fifty-dollar bills.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow. Now we can afford hard-cover books.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I like it just us three. [very quietly] I don't want it to change.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I love The Finer Things Club. My ex-wife used to have a book club, and I would read their book and sometimes listen from the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The Finer Things Club was not sanctioned by the Party Planning Committee. Renegade clubs are dangerous. I squashed the Weight Loss Buddy Support Group. They didn't need to gather. It was just gross.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [slurping her from her big cup] I don't know why I'm not in The Finer Arts Club [slurring]. It's bullcrap. [throws her cup on the floor, something splashes on the camera] You clean it up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [opens envelope Toby has handed him] Dear Andrew Bernard, after carefully examining your application to The Finer Things Club, we are unable to offer you a position at this place and time. We would, however, like to place you on a list in case an opportunity arises when your inclusion can be tolerated. Your position as an ongoing financial patron, however, is yours to cherish. Sincerely, The Finer Things Club. [pauses to consider] Yeees! [to Phyllis] I got waitlisted.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got into Cornell off the Wait List. A lot of people were like, "Oh, you just got into Cornell because your dad donated a building." No. Okay. I got into Cornell because I'm smart. I'm smart enough to have a dad who donates buildings to things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Utica is snoozeville, um, Albany are the prepsters, Nashua, no parking, um, Akron is haunted, Camden... is in a basement, Yonkers has the two hot girls, and here in Scranton, we are the cool guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo! Shotgun!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you're driving, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I am, but I want shotgun for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm... I'd prefer to sit in back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait! I wanted to sit next to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Dwight! Dwight, Jim is sitting next to me. You're gonna sit in the back left where I don't have to see your ugly moongob.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, that is so mean! You know what, I'm not going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Dwight, you're handsome. You're a very handsome man, get in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woohoo!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] So, there was no sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nnnno. Uh, turns out, it was just a really bad idea involving fire. But I think I fixed it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, you're going along with this now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have to. Pam, if I'm not there, someone's going to go to jail. Or die.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right. And, you wouldn't be able to talk to Karen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I promise you that has nothing to do with it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, yeah I don't want to see her get physically harmed, that's for sure.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because you love her? [baby voice] Because you love her very much?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, I'm gonna go now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Have fun with your girlfriend!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I will. [idiot voice]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm kidding around. We joke about that stuff all the time. I'm not really the jealous type, so, I don't care if Jim sees Karen. I care a little.

Quote.Speaker: Security guard
Quote.Text: They sprayed me in the eye. [Dwight and Michael are trapped by/under a copier in the stairwell]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [moans] Scranton rules! [sprays Silly Spray]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight! Stop it! [moans] Can you help me please, I'm being crushed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would it have killed you to spend the afternoon making love to her in a motel room? Like I begged you to? Pam would have understood. Heck, Pam would have done it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam is down for anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You embarrassed me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You embarrassed us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. We shoulda brought Andy. I cut a chunk out of my penis for nothing.
